issue.title: Fix faulty null checks

labels.name: L00-provider
labels.description: Relating to the provider module.

labels.name: L27-Permissions
labels.description: Issues relating to exposing permissions from the trusted MetaMask context to less-trusted contexts.

issue.body:
- **PENDING:**
  - [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-errors/pull/5
  - [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-inpage-provider/pull/19
  - [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/rpc-cap/pull/72
- For typechecks of the form `/typeof .+ (===|!==) 'object'/`, adds a check if the tested variable is truthy or falsy as appropriate.

issue.title: Update inpage provider, again
issue.body:
Updates `metamask-inpage-provider`, because it's my favorite thing to do.

Also, this solves `web3@1.x` compatibility issues that broke certain dapps on `develop`.

issue.title: Unstoppable domain resolution
issue.body:
Implemented .zil naming resolution using the namicorn library that supports both .eth and .zil names:
* Replaced existing ens library calls with namicorn
* Renamed classes and methods to be abstract from the naming service used

issue.title: Pocket
issue.body: Decentralized Infrastructure option (Pocket Network) PR: Closes #6782 Adds a decentralized infrastructure provider that allows users to use Pocket Network instead of the standard centralized provider. Changelog: 1. Updates the UI in 2 different places: A. Adds an additional option in the Network Dropdown: B. Adds an additional option in the default Network List in the Networks tab under Settings: 2. Added `json-rpc-pocket` dependency found here: [https://github.com/pokt-network/json-rpc-pocket](https://github.com/pokt-network/json-rpc-pocket). 3. Added file createPocketClient.js -> creates the Pocket middleware using the `json-rpc-pocket`. 4. Updated English locale files to add `pocket_` label texts where applicable. 5. Updated the Networks enums to be able to differentiate when the provider is Infura or when it is Pocket Network. 6. Updated the NetworkController to be able to detect and create a Pocket Middleware when Pocket Network is selected as the network provider. How To Use: 1. Click the Network Dropdown and select any desired network that says `- Pocket Network`. 2. Click the Account logo, click Settings, then click Network, and then select any desired network that says `- Pocket Network` Additionally a User tutorial guide will be posted to the Pocket Network Developer Portal found here: [Developer Portal](https://docs.pokt.network)

rename.from: Manage the permissions related to a specific connection
rename.to: Manage the permissions related to my connections

issue.title: Manage the permissions related to my connections
issue.body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to manage the permissions related to an account, so that I can revoke a site's ability to do something that I don't trust it with.

**Description**

This story is a context menu for managing the permissions of all sites connected to a specific account. This is an MVP iteration. In a future story, we'll be implementing the ability to manage the permissions on a per site basis.

The current designs are located here: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1969

**AC**

* Test coverage

issue.title: Update mocha version
issue.body:
This PR updates our Mocha version. I've removed a single test to make the test suite pass (I don't know of a way to make it pass).

The test I've removed uses `'uncaughtException'`<sup>[\[1\]][1]</sup> which should not be used:

> The correct use of `'uncaughtException'` is to perform synchronous cleanup of allocated resources (e.g. file descriptors, handles, etc) before shutting down the process. **It is not safe to resume normal operation after `'uncaughtException'`.**

  [1]:https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#process_warning_using_uncaughtexception_correctly
